title: RaycastParams
content:
This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.
To submit a bug report on the content, see
https://devforum.roblox.com/c/bug-reports/documentation-issues/72

name: RaycastParams
type: datatype
summary: |
  A container for parameters used in raycasting operations.
description: |
  The Datatype.RaycastParams data type stores parameters for
  Class.WorldRoot:Raycast() operations. The
  Datatype.RaycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances|FilterDescendantsInstances
  property stores an array of objects to use as either an inclusion or exclusion
  list based on the Datatype.RaycastParams.FilterType enum. If desired, the
  Datatype.RaycastParams.IgnoreWater property can be used to ignore
  Class.Terrain water, and the Datatype.RaycastParams.CollisionGroup
  property can specify a collision group for the raycasting operation.

  This object is different from the similarly named Datatype.RaycastResult
  which provides the results of a raycast.

  Unlike most data types in Luau, you can change all of the members of
  Datatype.RaycastParams without creating a new object, allowing you to reuse
  the same object repeatedly.
codesamples: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
constructors:
  - name: RaycastParams.new
    summary: Returns a blank Datatype.RaycastParams.
    description: |-
      Returns a blank Datatype.RaycastParams object. Unlike other data type
      constructors, this constructor does not have any parameters, so you should
      set its properties appropriately.
    parameters: []
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
constants: []
properties:
  - name: RaycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances
    type: Array
    summary: |
      An array of objects whose descendants are used in filtering raycasting
      candidates.
    description: |
      An array of objects whose descendants are used in filtering raycasting
      candidates.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: RaycastParams.FilterType
    type: RaycastFilterType
    summary: |
      Determines how the
      Datatype.RaycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances|FilterDescendantsInstances
      array is used.
    description: |
      Determines how the
      Datatype.RaycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances|FilterDescendantsInstances
      array is used, depending on the Enum.RaycastFilterType provided.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: RaycastParams.IgnoreWater
    type: bool
    summary: |
      Determines whether the water material is considered when raycasting
      against Class.Terrain.
    description: |
      Determines whether the water material is considered when raycasting
      against Class.Terrain.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: RaycastParams.CollisionGroup
    type: string
    summary: |
      The collision group used for the operation.
    description: |
      Specifies a collision group for the raycasting operation. Parts in
      collision groups that are set to not collide with this group are
      ignored. If this property is omitted, the raycast assumes the Default
      collision group.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: RaycastParams.RespectCanCollide
    type: bool
    summary: |
      Determines whether the raycast operation considers a part's
      Class.BasePart.CanCollide|CanCollide property value over its
      Class.BasePart.CanQuery|CanQuery value.
    description: |
      This property, if true, makes the raycast operation use an intersected
      part's Class.BasePart.CanCollide|CanCollide value in favor of its
      Class.BasePart.CanQuery|CanQuery value when determining whether that
      part is included in the Datatype.RaycastResult.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: RaycastParams.BruteForceAllSlow
    type: bool
    summary: |
      When enabled, the query will ignore all part collision properties and
      perform a brute-force check on every part.
    description: |
      When enabled, the query will ignore all part collision properties and
      perform a brute-force check on every part. This will negatively impact
      performance and should not be used in live experiences.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
methods:
  - name: RaycastParams:AddToFilter
    summary: |
      Adds the instances provided to
      Datatype.RaycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances|FilterDescendantsInstances.
    description: |
      For efficiency and simplicity, this method is the preferred way to add
      instances to the filter. It has the additional advantage that it allows
      Datatype.RaycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances|FilterDescendantsInstances
      to be updated from a parallel context.
    parameters:
      - name: instances
        type: Instance | Array
        default:
        summary: |
          An instance or an array containing instances to add.
    returns:
      - type: ()
        summary: ''
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
functions: []
